title: Zenfone 3 unusable - how to recover from ZenUI Launcher crashing at startup?

thread.text:
On my Zenfone 3 I've had a number of ZenUI Launcher crashes but always gotten past them, until now.
Asus ZenUI launcher is now consistently crashing on startup, so there is no way to do anything on the phone, no access to any menus or settings (that I know of).
Any advice on how to get past this? (and as next step, can this crap be uninstalled?)

You can't uninstall it without root, and even if you uninstall it, the phone will stop working altogether because the Launcher is the user interface you are actually seeing when you use the phone. If your phone is connected to the internet, logon to your Google account on a PC and open the Play Store website. Look for a third party launcher, like Nova, then install it to phone from the PC. Clicking on install on the website pushes the app to the phone. Once installed you will have a second launcher on your phone to use instead of ZenUI

Thanks! But if I push a new launcher to the phone from Play Store I assume it won't automatically become the default launcher? And then I'm still stuck at ZenUI Launcher crashing, as I can't access any settings on the phone to switch launcher.
I did try pushing Nova launcher from Play Store and actually managed to get it activated on the phone. Thanks a lot!! My phone was just a brick with this ZenUI Launcher loop.
Glad you sorted it out. I usually keep another launcher on the phone just in case one crashes.

Try Wallpaper Wizardrii - it does lock screens also.

title: My phone wont turn on

thread.text:
good day everyone
I have some problem i my asus zenfone 5.. i already change the pin charger and also the battery but still my phone wont turn on..do u guys have any opinion about this?

Plug the charger in and leave it overnight. If the battery is really dead, it could take an hour before it even starts charging. (It's almost 4 years old - the battery usually doesn't last that long.)
If that doesn't get it working, it has to go into a repair shop or back to ASUS - there's nothing you can do by yourself to fix it.

title: Unfortunately, Asus launcher has stopped?

thread.text:
My Asus Zenfone 5 keep popping out the msg 'Unfortunately, Asus Launcher has stopped'. And when it happens , I can't press anything. I've tried to restart but sometimes it will take a long time to start-up. So I keep restarting so sometimes the restart will success. Even after I restart it, the msg still popping out, it doesn't help to restart. Next, I've tried to use hard reset (recovery&factory reset). But the problem still occurs. What should I do? That must be something wrong in the device itself because no matter how many time you reset it the launcher stop msg keep popping out. 
Please help me to solve it! Any help is appreciated.
If can, please also tell me if that problem can be solve if send to repair? Even if it sent to repair, about how much is the price? (Malaysia Ringgit)

Welcome.
Try downloading and installing a different launcher from the Play Store. 
If no go, get back to us right here for more suggestions.

Thank you! But the problem is it keep popping out you can't even press anything!!!
Do you need me to send a video so you will understand how the condition is??
* I registered already so you will see the different name

Hey,
For the problem, our suggestion is to follow the below step:
Go to Settings => Select Apps => All =>Select Zen UI services and Power saver => Clear cache and clear data and Reboot.
Wipe cache partition from recovery & make sure your device is on the latest firmware version.
For More FAQ's & related question check :ZenTalk wish you a Merry Christmas

I had his problem too, but not a big deal... 
WHat you can do is go to settings->apps->launcher-> clear cache. (If this doesn't work then you can try another method)
Follow the same method and then fore stop it and restart it again.. 
Done!

title: USPS --"delivered to military agent". what is this

thread.text: sent my zenpad to asus service center, but says "delivered to military agent". it went to grapevine, tx. why would it go to a military agent?

I did some internet research and found out it could be a number of things but often it just means that "the front desk" signed for your package NOT there addressee. You might try calling the service center and/or the USPS on the next business day and trying to find out what is up.

You have your standard charger came with your phone ? If yes, plug that and see whether the phone is indicating charging.
Post the results here.

Have you tried a soft reset? Don't worry, you won't lose any data. Press and hold down the Power button for approximately 8-10 seconds. See if that does anything.
Keep us updated!

Welcome to Android Central! Are you saying that the phone was working and charging normally until you plugged it into a new powerbank?
My guess is that either the battery or the microUSB port failed. You probably need to bring it to a repair shop.

Ask them to test the battery and the charging port. It's also possible that the motherboard has failed.
They already tried it . sir .. but it seems it still not working .... they've. already check the battery .. but still not working... i think the main problem is the Motherboard...
That's too bad. Is this the original Zenfone? I'm assuming it's no longer under warranty.

title: Echo filtering not working during phone call

thread.text:
Hello there,
I'm using my ASUS ZenFone 5 T00F about 2 years. But last two months I'm a problem.
The remote person who listens to my talk by phone call facing a lot of noise when I'm outdoor. I've changed my phone microphone but problem not solve.
When I'm using WhatsApp or Facebook messenger or another app then the phone is pretty well. The only problem occurs when I call someone by the phone call.
I've reset phone two times and also downgraded Lollipop to Kitkat. After resetting sometimes calls is ok but after one day or less than one-day same problem started.
What can I do? Please advise me.
Thanks

Welcome to Android Central! Is the phone in a case? If so, make sure make sure the secondary mic (which is probably along the top of the phone) isn't blocked. A blocked secondary mic might cause problems with noise cancellation.

Welcome to Android Central! Unfortunately, water damage can be unpredictable and progressive, so it's hard to say what you can do to fix this. It might just be the Power button, but the problems might still persist even after replacing it.

title: Need help! for Asus Zenfone 5. No display. Not charging. Vibrates randomly.

thread.text:
Hello everyone. Please help me.
My phone hang while watching a video. I refresh it by turning it off. But to my surprise, as far as I can remember, the screen turned black (slowly) as it turned off. So I open it after a few minutes, but sadly it never open since. I tried to charged it but no response. I plugged it on my laptop but no response. Except that it vibrates when I plugged it on. Then after a few minutes, no response again.
I have a feeling that my phone is charging while attached to my laptop, because the back feels hot (but not too hot).
So what shall I do about this issue? Can someone please tell me that my last option is to get it fix at the asus service here in the Philippines?
please. I really need help.

Welcome to Android Central! Plug it into a wall outlet and let it charge undisturbed overnight. Then try powering on by pressing and holding Power for at least 15-20 seconds. If nothing happens (or if the battery still gets hot while charging), then the battery may have failed. You'd have to bring it to a repair shop to replace the battery (or to further investigate the problem).

title: Why does my Asus ZenFone 5 stuck at logo after update?

thread.text:
Hi everyone, i ask for your help cause i have a common problem but the fixes i found in the forum didn't work for me: my ZenFone 5 stucks at "Asus" logo with a "loading loop" wheel below that.
I know this post may be long but i beg you to read all steps:
1) Phone stucks at logo, but could enter recovery (pressing vol + down), i've updated it via external SD card (official firmware but didn't work) then i've wiped data and did a factory reset. Phone still stucks at logo.
2) Now i can't even enter recovery mode... when pressing vol + down it shows 2 options but whatever i choose the phone reboots. If i press vol + up it says "CSC mode, long press power to restart. Phone still stucks.
3) Now (after some time) the phone's screen doesn't show anything, nor charging icon or notification led when recharging, but strangely the computer recognizes it as a device when connected via USB cable, and the led turns on when i do this.
A friend told me to follow a guide that says to install "Intel Soc USB driver", i did that. After installing, when connecting the device, this should pop up in the Device manager: http://s5.postimg.org/feo7yfj4m/cloverview.jpg but doesn't show to me.
I've also tried Asus flashtool guide... at step 4 it says to click in the box icon and choose the firmware RAW file, so i've downloaded a raw firmware for the ZenFone 5, but oddly it doesn't let me choose any raw file.
Note: the phone is recognized by the pc as "QHSUSB_BULK", so i've tried to update its driver with qualcomm drivers, and now it's recognized as "Qualcom MMC Usb storage device". But i think i've did a wrong thing cause my friend told me i should have choosed some kind of official driver
Thanks in advance for your help
Moved to the ZenFone forum.

title: (Urgent) Why does my Asus Zenfone 5 stuck at logo after firmware update?

thread.text:
Sorry guys if i ask for help, i've tried ton of fixes but still didn't resolve it, seems like other ppl had this problem but the fixes don't work for me...
Problem 1: Zenfone 5 stucked at "Asus logo + loading wheel" after turning on (i could enter in recovery mode but not droidboot)
What i did --> entered recovery, updated firmware via external SD, formatted phone and wiped cache
Problem 2: Zenfone 5 still stucks at logo, but now when i press vol+up it says "CSC mode, long press power to restart" and when i press vol+down it shows two options, and whatever i choose the phone reboots.
Problem 3: Zenfone 5's display is always black, doesn't show anything when charging or after pressing any button, but the PC recognizes it as "QHSUSB_BULK" device
What i did --> searched for guides, tried to update QHSUSB_BULK's drivers with Qualcomm drivers, and then it's recognized as a disk drive "Qualcom MMC Usb storage device". 
What happened --> a person told me i choose the wrong drivers, and i have to download drivers from official site, but which ones?
This person also suggested me to follow "asus flashtool" guide, but when i press the "box" to open a RAW firmware it doesn't let me choose the raw firmwares i downloaded.
This person also suggested me to follow the guide called "Hard Bricked Zenfone Unbrick (Last method to try) 
But in step 3 it says i should get "Intel Soc USB driver" and that doesn't show in my computer management
Sorry if i wrote too much, i really beg for your help, thanks in advance

title: HELP! My phone can't move apps to SD card

thread.text:
I have an ASUS Zenfone 5 which is not rooted. One day, all my photos (taken from the camera) are gone. But my saved pictures are still there. When I installed an app, I usually move it to external sd card using app2sd. It gave me notifications that the app can be moved. But when I tried to move it, the button "Move to SD Card" is greyed out and unclickable.Now I don't have enough space to download apps! I have an ASUS T00F Android 4.4 and my SD card is a sandisk 8gb card. I'll appreciate all kind of help
Posted via the Android Central App

Welcome to Android Central! Run SD Insight to make sure the card is valid, and not counterfeit. If it's valid, Unmount the card in Settings>Storage, remove the card, and insert it into your computer and run chkdsk to look for bad sectors: http://forums.androidcentral.com/amb...d-sd-card.html

Then, what should I do next? The app showed me all of the datas and I already know the chkdsk command. But I'm afraid I will lose all my files. Will it delete my files??
Posted via the Android Central App

Are you saying that SD Insight confirmed the card is valid, and not counterfeit?
You can always back up all of the SD card data onto your computer hard drive before running chkdsk.

replies.text:
Yeah, of course. It showed all of my datas. I'll show you the pic later. For the command, do you need to conmect the phone to pc or use a micro sd reader?
Posted via the Android Central App

thread.text:
Try to connect your SD Card to pc, does it recognise your SD Card? Can you move some files from/to your SD Card?
Or just take a pict and put to sd card, does it save?
If it's not, maybe your SD Card is broken.
Merged threads. Please continue the discussion in this thread, rather than creating new threads with the same question--thanks!

Yeah, I'll try it later. Thanks for the suggestion
Posted via the Android Central App

That's the pictures. And I've just noticed something. I'm using LINE Camera, but when I move the storage to SD card it says it can't. I'll give the pic later.

title: Can I take photosphere on an Asus Zenfone 4?

thread.text: anybody have an apps for do that?
Welcome to Android Central! Photosphere requires a gyroscope, which the Zenfone 4 doesn't have, so it won't be possible.

replies.text: whether there are applications that do not require a gyroscope?

thread.text: I really doubt it. Photospheres require the phone to know if it's pointing up, down or straight ahead. That requires a gyroscope. I don't think any of the other sensors (like the accelerometer) can emulate that.

replies.text: How about "360 panorama" apps by occipital??

thread.text: You could always try installing it from Google Play Store. If the Play Store says it's incompatible, it probably also needs a gyroscope.

replies.text:
360 Panorama has been removed from google play. But now im using 360 panorama and work perfectly without gyro... 
I hope someone update this apps for better experince 
Thank you very much

thread.text: Do you have a link to the apk?

But you can search in google

title: How can I turn my Asus Zenfone 5 off so that it will charge?

thread.text: please help me guys, i really dont know what to do about it

Hi and welcome to AndroidCentral. 
Your device should charge even if it is on.

Recalibrate battery
To recalibrate battery,charge your phone to 100% without interruption.
then discharge it normally till 0%(phone gets switched off).
charge it to 100% in switched off condition and keep it in that state for a little more time.
now switch on your phone in charged condition and unplug when ASUS logo appears.
keep the phone unused for 5 mins.
you will get far better battery life as the battery stats.bin file will be updated.
You may log on to zentalk forum to post your problem.

replies.text: Posted via the Android Central App

thread.text: Longpress power button until it offs mate.

title: How do I fix my Zenfone 5 lite A502CG Hard Bricked?

thread.text: i update manually my zenfone 5 lite a502cg 1.i download the latest firmware 2. i install all requirements . 3 after that i turn off my phone and then i press volume up + power botton = Droidboot then i choose recovery after that my cellphone has rebooting itself and i saw No command and i tap volume down and volume up im here now in Android system recovery or Fastboot then i choose apply update from ADB and next step i open fastboot falsh tool in my computer and i type in command adb sideload UL-ASUS_T00K-WW-2.21.40.29-user.zip after 100% i see in my cellphone update failed or error install aborted i reboot system now and i stock in ASUS IN SEARCH OF INCREDIBLE powered by android and ican't access in droidboot Fastboot only

title: How to partition internal memory ?

thread.text: Hello. I am using Asus Zenfone Go zc500tg . Although the internal memory of the phone is 8gb , I can only use 4gb of it. The other 4gb is being used by the system . Is there anyway I can partition the internal sd card and use the full 8 gb as my internal memory?

Welcome to Android Central! That 4 GB used by the system is taken up by system files. The OS has to be stored somewhere. The internal storage that a phone is advertised with is never the total that is available to the user--it's always some number that's lower (and yes, this is also the case with iPhones). 8 GB phones usually have about 3-4 GB available to the user.

title: Asus Zenfone 5 application updates, why don't they finish?

There is no any messages saying that is something wrong.

Welcome to Android Central! Does this happen on both wi-fi and mobile data?
Try going to Settings>Apps>All, select Google Play Store, and Clear Cache/Clear Data, then Force Stop. Do the same for Download Manager. Now try again.

title: Zenfone 5 (android L) charging speed

thread.text:
Is every ZenFone 5's charging speed slow or just mine? My battery charged about 10% every half hour, about 4 hour to fully charged. Zenfone 5 user, please tell me?
Posted via the Android Central App

@ iScreamSoda
Try to re-calibrate battery
To re-calibrate battery, charge your phone to 100% without interruption, then discharge it normally till 0%(phone gets switched off).
Charge it to 100% in switched off condition and keep it in that state for a little more time now switch on your phone in charged condition and unplug when ASUS logo appears keep the phone unused for 5 mins, you will get far better battery life as the battery stats.bin file will be updated.

title: Why can't I send a picture message on Zenfone 2E?

thread.text: I recently bought an ASUS Zenfone 2E and I haven't been able to send or receive any picture messages and I don't know why. Can someone help me out? I have AT&T
What you mean u can't send picture? I assume this is MMS. You have to configure APN for this. I can't post link. But go to google and type "at&t mms android".

I am having issues with the same phone as well, but I have made 1 discovery. You need to go to settings and then Data. Slide the data "switch" to ON. This will allow you to text send and receive pictures but unfortunately your phone will keep asking you Sign-in to Network. I am currently try to figure out how to make that stop.
This all stems from not having a data plan, but I think there must be a way around it.

Hi anniefears,
You need to enable data for sending picture & check if your MMS APN settings are correct

thread.text:

Welcome to Android Central! It's not advisable to delete things unless you're absolutely certain of what they are. You're probably out of luck. Recovering deleted files from Internal Storage requires rooting (which in itself might overwrite that data). See this guide: http://forums.androidcentral.com/amb...ted-files.html

B. Diddy is correct. Don't delete anything you're not absolutely positive you know it's OK to delete.
You may end up having to reinstall the OS. Chances of recovering those files are poor. See this:http://forums.androidcentral.com/one...ml#post4768111

title: How to disable Android 5.0 Asus Zenfone7 K01N Emergency Alert: Low Zone 80?

thread.text: After I upgrade my Asus Zenfone7 K01N from Android 4.4 to 5.0, the Emergency alerts saying "LOW ZONE 80%" always pop up. It really annoy me because it disturbing me from typing text, and also disturbing me when I watch videos. Why did this happen? and how to disable the alerts? Thanks in Advance
Welcome to Android Central! I've never seen a message like that on my Zenfone 2. Is that all it says?
Yes. That is all it say. Sometime it say "LOW ZONE 80%" and sometime "LOW ZONE 25%". The percentage number is random. This is the screenshot of the emergency alert

That's weird. "Emergency Alert" suggests it's from the Emergency Broadcast System, or something similar. Go into your Call Settings and look for those emergency alert settings. See if you can turn any of them off. I don't have my Zenfone 2 in front of me right now, so I can't tell you the exact menu location yet.

The problem is now solved. The emergency alert did not appear anymore after I take out my sim card from my Asus and change it with another sim card. I think my sim card cause this problem and not the update. Thanks for helping me with this. Cheers
Posted via the Android Central App

title: Why is my battery drain so fast and heated fast?

thread.text: my asus zenfone 5 battery drain so fast and heated fast and become hang i have used only for six month i have used it happen by version or too much app install

Welcome to Android Central! Charge up to 100%, then let it drain to 20-30% with normal usage, without charging in between. Then show us:
1. The main Settings>Battery screen.
2. The fullscreen battery graph screen (which shows Awake time and Cell Signal Strength).
3. The Screen category (to see total Screen On time).
4. The Cell Standby category, if present (to see Time Without Signal).http://forums.androidcentral.com/amb...d-central.html
What you're describing often ends up being a failing or defective battery, so you might have to look into getting it replaced.

title: Can I manually keep up-to-date OS and apps on my rooted ZenFone?

thread.text:
Hello,
I am aware, that Asus does provide instructions on how to root their Zenfone 5. that Asus also provides firmware downloads from their Support website.
However, per Asus, I would stop receiving automatic updates from Asus if I were to root my phone. 
Thus, what I'd like to know is, after having rooted my phone: Will I be able to manually keep my phone firmware up-to-date by fetching the firmware file from Asus Support site and manually applying the firmware update myself? Will I be able to update my non-Asus apps from PlayStore just like I can do now on my unrooted phone?
Everytime I ask Asus this question, they give me a blanket and somewhat unhelpful response, saying something to the effect of, "We don't advise you to root your phone as you will lose your warranty and stop receiving automatic updates." 
I have already upgraded to Lollipop / 5.0 last week, and I don't think Asus will be releasing Android M. So, I'm thinking of taking the plunge and rooting my Zenfone 5. 
Would greatly appreciate your advice.
Many thanks,
/pi_ni

replies.text:
Welcome to Android Central!
More than likely you will not be able to tell the phone to fetch the update. If it does manage to download the update it will more than likely fail to install. If you tried to flash the update yourself to the phone from the firmware they have on their site more than likely you will lose root access if it doesn't fail to install.

thread.text:
Thanks
Posted via the Android Central App

title: Where do I post a report on a bad phone and service?

thread.text:
Asus Zenfone 5 with bad camera two phones brought one great one very bad, photo's to proove difference and was told had two year warranty and ASUS agree its a hardware problem but tell me its not there problem,
I would like to inform everyone about the dismal service ASUS supply and the fact that they say its not there problem with emails to proove them denying responsibility.
Regards Peter

Welcome to Android Central.
I'm sorry if you've had a bad experience but we'd need more details and preferably both sides of the story for this to be of any use. I'll pass your comments on though.
Posted via the Android Central App
If you are wondering about anywhere to report ASUS, perhaps the Better Business Bureau.

ASUS doesn't seem to care about customer service. I've had run-ins with them before (a desktop with an expansion slot but "the customer isn't supposed to open the computer" kind of stupidity, and they have no idea what escalation or level 2 means), so I've just stopped buying their products. I'll praise companies with good customer service (and have here, many times), but I won't deal with companies that make getting a warranty replacement a full-time job.
If enough people took that attitude (the general attitude of the American public seems to be "well, you can't expect everything to work right"), the bad companies would be out of business.
You do have legal recourse when it comes to a warranty (it's a legally binding contract), but even for a flagship device, it's not worth the expense. If you win, you lose. If you lose, you lose more.

Thanks for all the replies 
I was just wanting to let people know that they need to think twice about buying a ZENFONE 5
as they are not a consistent product.I have allready started legal proceedings with the supplier not that I am expecting to get far,But we will see.
Regards Peter

title: New Zenfone 2 doesn't activate with H2O.

thread.text:
I bought the new Asus Zenfone 2 ZE551ML. I tried connecting to my provider H2O and my Sims weren't able to connect. I tried the same Sim in my old phone and it's activated.
I was told the Asus Zen 2 and H2O were good to go.
I talked to Asus and gave him all the info like what bands etc and waiting for him to get back to me.
I live in LA, heavily populated. My service goes through AT&T with H2O as my MNVO.
This is depressing.
My bands are 850/1900 for 3G+HSPA, i'm also covered for 4LTE.
What's the problem?

replies.text:
Welcome to Android Central!
You may need to set up the APN settings for H2O.https://www.h2owirelessnow.com/mainC...taManualConfig

title: Asus Zenfone 2,4,5,6 users, let share your experience here

thread.text:
Hii, I'm using Asus Zenfone 5 with 2GB ram and 16GB rom. Overall, this smartphone is so good, no lag and had good performance on HD games. Multitasking is good too, with 2 gigs of ram which is big enough for me. And latest new from Asus, Zenfone 4,5,6 will get Lollipop update on mid May 2015. What do think guys? Are you using this smartphone too?? Share your experience here.
Note : Sorry if my english looks bad, it's not my native language.
Posted via the Android Central App
Everything is good except battery life. Has to recharge twice per day when use it heavily. I own a Zenfone 4.

The Zenfone 5 is one of the most popular phones right now in the Philippines. My 8-month experience with two of them has been really good. Battery is manageable with proper use. Performance is well above average. Looks can be stunning, depends on if you use a case or not, and what case you use. And the frequent software update is a big plus. I got mine in Jellybean, has been updated to Kitkat, and we're now expecting the Lollipop update anytime this month.
A very good phone over-all.

Thanks

thread.text: Yes, but you can also have a clock widget on a homescreen, so that's why I was asking. You don't have any clock widgets on your homescreen?

title: Asus ZenFone 4, ZenFone 5, ZenFone 6 Android 5.0 Lollipop Update Delayed

thread.text:
Asus has announced that the ZenFone 4, ZenFone 5, and ZenFone 6 smartphones' scheduled Android 5.0 Lollipop update has been delayed.
The Taiwanese company was expected to rollout the Android 5.0 Lollipop updates in mid-May for the popular Asus ZenFone 4, ZenFone 5, and ZenFone 6 smartphones. The company confirmed the news via its official ZenTalk forum and revealed that issues in verification delayed the update.Source

title: Can I get some help with several problems with my recently bought Zenfone 5 lite?

thread.text:
A couple of days ago I bought a Zenfone 5 lite because I wanted to switch from IOS to Android and I have the following problems:
- It won't connect to my uni's wifi. I tried several times (also in airplane mode) but it just doesn't work. It shows that there's good signal strength, but when I try to connect it, it says ''connecting...'' . After a minute it says ''saved, secured with 802.1x''. Then again ''connecting...''. And it keeps repeating this over and over. I really don't know what to do.
- The clock shows ''Eastern Time'' with a wrong time.
- I don't know how to download my itunes library on the phone.
- It puts all the pictures I've taken and I've downloaded from my notebook in one single file.
- I cannot take screenshots, I tried by clicking the turnoff button and the volume button at the same time and by clicking the home button and the turnoff button, but neither of those works.
- It doesn't show the messages I received on the screen when the phone is locked.
If anybody could help me that would be much appreciated.

title: for use ReverseTethering computer to android

thread.text: what can i do for accept superuser request in asus zenfone 5 without root

You won't get a request from Superuser unless su makes it - and if su is installed, the phone is rooted. (That's what rooting is - installing su.)
If an app needs root and the phone isn't rooted you have 2 choices - don't use the app or root the phone.

title: My Asus Zenfone 5 will connect to my pc but not transfer. How can I get this working?

Welcome to Android Central! How did you transfer the video? If it was any way besides the approved methods (like using UltraViolet), then we can't help you here--copying DVDs/Blu-Ray discs violates copyright law (even if you own it and copied it for your own use), and shouldn't be discussed here.

title: On my Asus Zenfone 5 - 8GB - (updated to Android KitKat 4.4.1) I got the 'Screen Of Death' 'Blank Screen', is there anyway of coming back from this?

thread.text:
Last night my friend connected his Asus Zenfone 5 to his PC but he had some problem connecting it. So, he used an OTG cable to connect his pendrive. But that too didn't work. So pulled the OTG cable out and locked the screen manually. After a while when he tried to unlock it, he couldn't. The screen was dead blank and did not respond. Even the backlight for the home button didn't glow. When he tried calling the number, it was not reachable. I surfed in the internet about this, and i read about Sleep Of Death(SoD). But to fix that problem they said to hold the power button for 10-15 seconds. I tried that too. Nothing happened. Zenfone 5 has an in-built battery, so i cannot pull the battery out to make sure the device is off. I don't even know if the phone is still on or off. He updated 'ASUS Call Screen', 'Skype' and 'Camera' from Google play officially, the previous day. What should we do?
Any kind of help is appreciable.
Thank you so much in advance...!

title: How do I disable talk to speech?

thread.text: hello...im having problem right now, im using asus zenfone 5...and this pop up always came out, "unfortunately, google talk to speech engine has stopped...i dont know whats wrong but i dont want this function very annoying i try to disable this function and searching it everywhere but still nothing, please help me

Welcome to Android Central! Does a reboot help at all?
If not, make sure Google Text-to-Speech is fully updated. Go to the Google Play Store, and search for Google Text-to-Speech. If it says "Update," then tap on it. If you've never updated it before, the Play Store usually won't prompt you for the first update--you have to find it yourself (an odd bug that Google has never fixed).
If you're fully updated and it's still happening, try going to Settings>Apps>All, select Google Text-to-speech Engine, and Clear Cache/Clear Data, then Force Stop. Now see if it happens again. If you never use Text-to-Speech, you can Disable this app as well.
